content.title: Medical Assistance (APB&OCWWB)
content.beneficiary: Registered workers of the Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB)
content.details: The scheme “Medical Assistance” was started by the Department of Labour and Employment, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh for registered workers of the Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB). The state government has proposed and implemented this scheme through the APB&OCWWB for providing medical assistance to registered workers who are hospitalized for five or more than five days due to accident or disease.
benefits: ₹ 2000/- only for the first five days.
₹100/- each for the remaining days subject to a maximum of ₹15,000/- if disability occurs due to accident.
Additional benefits up to a maximum of ₹25,000/- depending upon the percentage of disability.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Arunachal Pradesh.
The applicant must be employed in the Building and Other Construction works.
The applicant should be registered with Labour Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).
The applicant’s membership must be active at the time of application.
The applicant must have a disease or had an accident for which he/she should be hospitalised or put in plaster at his/her residence.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter ID card, etc.
Original copy of registration card /membership card of the board
Bank Account number/ front page of the passbook

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to provide medical assistance to registered workers who are hospitalized for five or more than five days due to an accident or disease.

faqs.question: By which department was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: Department of Labour and Employment, Government of Arunachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: What is the full form of APB&OCWWB?
faqs.answer: Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

faqs.question: How much cash assistance will be given to the eligible worker during his/her hospitalization?
faqs.answer: Cash assistance of ₹2000/- will be given to the worker for the first five days and ₹100/- each for the remaining days subject to a maximum of ₹15,000/- during his/her hospitalization.

faqs.question: What is the addition benefit to be given to the worker?
faqs.answer: The Additional benefit up to a maximum of ₹25,000/- will be given to the eligible worker depending upon the percentage of disability.

faqs.question: Who is eligible under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The worker who have a disease or had an accident for which he/she should be hospitalized or put in plaster at his/her residence is eligible to take benefit of the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a worker /labour of Arunachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Arunachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to have registered under Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the labour/worker must be a registered worker under the Board.

faqs.question: Can a worker also eligible to take the benefits of the scheme if membership has been expired?
faqs.answer: No, the worker’s membership shall be active to take the benefits of the scheme.

faqs.question: How can I avail the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant needs to contact Registering Officers, APB&OCWWB of the respective District.
